verse.name: v1
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Since long ago at Bethany we parted, Within my heart there is a ceaseless void; How can I take my harp down from the willow? How can my songs without Thee be enjoyed? And when at night I’m keeping lonely vigil- Grown numb alike to sorrow and to cheer- Then I recall the promise of Thy coming, But sigh: O Lord, why, why Thou dost not yet appear?{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v2
v3
v4
verse.lines: {lang-eng}What exile cannot but desire his homeland And long his people once again to greet? What soul on alien soil forgets his kindred? What parted lovers never yearn to meet? O Lord, how can these earthly loves and pleasures With all the joy of Thy return compare? Then, if I cannot here behold Thy countenance, What can I do but sigh till Thou, my Lord, appear?{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Could’st Thou, O Lord, forget Thy word of promise Soon to return and take me unto Thee? Yet day by day and year by year I’ve waited And still I wait, and no return I see! Remember, Lord, the years I have been waiting While Thy dear footsteps linger far away. How long? How long? Oh! must I wait still longer Till Thou shalt come again in glorious array?{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: {lang-eng}From generation unto generation Thy saints have come and gone, but have not seen Thy glorious promise pass into fulfilment. How long, how very long the time has been! Why cannot we, dear Lord, discern Thy footsteps? Why are the heavens still so closely sealed? Oh! must our waiting be prolonged still further Before Thou in Thy matchless splendor art revealed?{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Lord, I recall the many years I’ve waited For Thy return-yet, Lord, not I alone, But Thy dear saints through many generations- Beseeching Thee to come back for Thine own. To countless tears and countless fervent pleadings, By Thine appearing haste to make reply. Oh, may Thou come, the echo of the ages, Come, come and answer now this mighty corp’rate cry!{/lang-eng}
